subject: thoughts to live by
verse: This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down His life for us, and we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers. (Christian brothers and sisters). (I John 3:16)
reflection: "Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friend." Here our Lord reveals to us the inconceivable love that moved Him to die for us. And now under the influence and in the power of that love dwelling in us comes the message: "We ought to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters." Nothing less is expected of us than a Christ-like life and a Christ-like love proving itself in all our fellowship with believers.
prayer: Dear Lord as we live daily in You, may we learn to lay down our lives for one another as Christ did for us. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "If the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed." (John 8:36) Because through Christ Jesus the law of the Spirit of life, set me free from the law of sin and death. (Romans 8:2) It is for freedom that Christ has set us free. 'Stand firm, ' then, and do not let yourselves be burden again by a yoke of slavery. (Galatians 5:1)
reflection: Christ died to set us free from sin and from a long list of laws and regulations. 'Yes ~ Christ came to set us free ~ not free to do whatever we want because that would lead us back into slavery to our selfish desires. But, thanks to Christ, we are now free and able to do what was impossible before ~ to live unselfishly. Those who appeal to their freedom so they can have their own way or indulge their own desires are falling back into sin. But it is also wrong to put a burden of law keeping on Christians. We must stand against those who would enslave us with rules methods, or special conditions for being saved or growing in Christ.
prayer: Thank You, Lord, for True Freedom, lead us in the truth. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: May I never boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world. (Galatians 6:14)
reflection: I think that it goes without saying, if we stop and think, 'that the world is full of enticements. Each and every day we are confronted with subtle pressures. The only way to escape these destructive influences is to ask God to help crucify our interest in them, just as Paul did. Let me pose this question to you ~ How much do the interest of this world matter to you??? For more on this concept look up (Galatians 2:20 & 5:24)
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the blessing of the cross, for it teaches me the worthlessness of my own efforts and the complete corruption of my own nature. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "And surely I am with you always to the very end of the age." (Matthew 28:20b)
reflection: So deep was the disciples consciousness of His presence, that when Christ spoke of His leaving them to go to the Father, their hearts were filled with deep sorrow. The presence of Christ had become indispensable to them; they could not think of living without Him. To comfort them, Christ gave them the promise of the Holy Spirit with the assurance that they then would have Himself in His heavenly presence in a sense far deeper and more intimate than they had ever known on earth. The law of their first vocation remained unchanged: to be with Him, to live in unbroken fellowship with Him would be the secret of power to preach and to testify of Him. Remember, it is by His Holy Spirit's presence that we receive the power to witness of His love for all people.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You for Your abiding presence, for the freshness and the power of the heavenly life. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus came and told His disciples, "I have been given complete authority in heaven and on earth." (Matthew 28:18)
reflection: God gave Jesus authority over heaven and earth. On the basis of that authority, Jesus told His disciples to make more disciples as they preached, baptized, and taught. With this same authority, Jesus still commands us to tell others the Good News and make them disciples for the Kingdom. Let us remember, that this power is never meant to be experienced as if it were our own. It is only as Jesus Christ as a living Person dwells and works with His divine energy in our own heart and life that there can be power in our preaching and personal testimony.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would be sensitive, to Your calling to every believer, to contribute in some small way to share the Word. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God assured Moses that: "I will be with you." (Exodus 3:12a)
reflection: How often, when we are asked to do something, do we act like Moses and make excuses??? Moses made excuses because he felt inadequate for the job God gave him to do. Now it was quiet natural for him to feel that way. He was inadequate by himself. BUT God wasn't asking him to work alone. He offered Moses other resources to help (God himself, Aaron, and the ability to do miracles). God often calls us to do tasks that seem to difficult, but He doesn't ask us to do them alone. God also offers us His resources, just as He did to Moses. We should not hide behind our inadequacies, as Moses did, but look behind ourselves to the great resources available. Then we can allow God to use our unique contributions.
prayer: Thank You, Lord, for the reassuring words, "I am with you always." Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: This is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world (John 4:42)
reflection: Omnipotence and Omnipresence are what are called the natural attributes of God. They have their true worth only ~ only when linked to and inspired by His moral attributes, holiness and love. When our Lord spoke of the omnipotence having been given Him 'all power on earth and in heaven' and the omnipresence 'His presence with each of His disciples' His words pointed to all that which lies at the root of all ~ His divine glory as the Savior of the world and Redeemer of men. It was because He humbled Himself and became obedient to death, the death of the Cross, that God so highly exalted Him. His share as the man Christ Jesus in the attributes of God was owing to the work He had done in His perfect obedience to the will of God and the finished redemption He had brought forth for the salvation of the world. Yes, it is Jesus Christ who saves His people from their sins, who rules over a people willing in the day of His power and proves in them that He enables them to say, "I delight to do Thy will, O my God, " who says, "Lo, I am with you always."
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, You are the Savior of the world and Redeemer of men. Help us to hear and obey Your command to go into all the world and preach the Gospel and obey all that You have commanded. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world hath been crucified unto me, and I unto the world." (Galatians 6:14)
reflection: When Jesus said to His disciples, "Lo, I am with you always, " It was as the Crucified One, who had shown them His hands and His feet, that gave the promise. And to each one of us who seek to claim the promise, it is of the first importance that we should realize: it is the crucified Jesus who promises, who offers, to be with us every day. May not this be one reason why we find it so difficult to expect and enjoy the abiding presence? ~ because we do not glory in the Cross by which we are crucified with Him." They that are Christ's have crucified the flesh with its affections and lusts ~ and yet how little we have learned that the world has been crucified to us and that we are free from its power.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, help us to learn the lesson, that it is You the crucified Christ, who comes to walk with us every day, and in whose power we too are to live can say: "I have been crucified with Christ, " "Christ crucified lives in me." Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says' "But when God, who set me apart from birth and called me by His grace, was pleased ~ to reveal His Son to me that I might preach Him among the Gentiles, I did not consult any man ~ (Galatians 1:15-16)
reflection: Because God was guiding Paul's ministry, Paul wasn't doing anything that God hadn't already planned and given him power to do. Similarly God appointed Jeremiah to be His spokesman before Jeremiah was born (Jeremiah 1:5). God knows each of us intimately as well ~ and He chose each of us to be His before we were born (see Psalm 139). He wants us to draw close to Him and to fulfill the purpose He has for our life.
prayer: Dear Lord, Help me to always believe in the abiding presence of Christ as the sure gift to each one who trusts in Him fully. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Devote yourself to prayer with an alert mind and a thankful heart. (Colossians 4:2)
reflection: Have you ever grown tired of praying for someone or something? In our Bible verse today Paul says we should "devote" ourselves to prayer and be "alert" in prayer. Our persistence is an expression of our faith that God answers our prayers. Faith shouldn't die if the answers come slowly, because the delay may be God's way of working His will in our life. When you feel tired of praying, remember God said, "I will never leave you or forsake you." So by this we know that God is present, always listening, always answering, maybe not in the ways you had hoped for, but in ways that He knows is best.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, come and live in my heart today. Help me to be sensitive to Your presence. Amen.
